definition[0]: to become completely dry or to make something completely dry, especially after it has been very wet
example[0]: In summer, water the plants regularly and never let the soil dry out.
example[1]: The kitchen was flooded and it took ages to dry it out.
definition[1]: to stop drinking alcohol after you have become an alcoholic, or to make someone do this
example[2]: He’s been drying out at a private clinic.
example[3]: The hospital dried Michael out and sent him home.
